benchmark_details.name: FABLES (Faithfulness Annotations for Book-Length Summarization)
benchmark_details.overview: FABLES is the first large-scale human evaluation of faithfulness and content selection in LLM-generated summaries of fictional books, collecting 3,158 claim-level annotations from 26 books to assess summarization quality.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the faithfulness and content selection in book-length summarization generated by LLMs.

data.source: Human annotations based on LLM-generated summaries of 26 recently published books.
data.annotation: Manual annotation by human evaluators who have read the books.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on human annotation performance on claim-level summarization.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy and F1 scores indicate better summarization fidelity and content selection.
methodology.baseline_results: CLAUDE-3-OPUS outperformed other models in faithfulness, with 90% of its claims rated as faithful.
methodology.validation: Inter-annotator agreement and self-consistency metrics were used to validate the quality of annotations.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: All annotators provided consent for their contributions and received fair compensation.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: Annotators consented to the use and publication of their annotations.
